overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the color picker supports the specified color picking mode; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method is invoked when the `NSColorPanel` is first initialized: It is used to attempt to restore the user’s previously selected mode. It is also invoked by `NSColorPanel`‘s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorPanel/mode-swift.property] method to find the color picker that supports a particular mode. See this protocol description’s list of the unique mode values for the standard color pickers used by the Application Kit.

# supportsMode(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether or not the receiver supports the specified picking mode.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func supportsMode(_ mode: NSColorPanel.Mode) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **mode**: The color picking mode.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the color picker supports the specified color picking mode; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method is invoked when the `NSColorPanel` is first initialized: It is used to attempt to restore the user’s previously selected mode. It is also invoked by `NSColorPanel`‘s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorPanel/mode-swift.property] method to find the color picker that supports a particular mode. See this protocol description’s list of the unique mode values for the standard color pickers used by the Application Kit.

## Getting Color Picker Information

- **currentMode()**: Returns the receiver’s current mode (or submode, if applicable).
